intro: Crypteronia affinis, commonly known as the yellow-flowered crypteronia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape. Its most distinctive feature is its clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. Crypteronia affinis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
